sen.j: 一条 実通（いちじょう さねみち、天明8年8月2日 (旧暦)（1788年9月1日）－文化_(元号)2年5月25日 (旧暦)（1805年6月22日））は、江戸時代後期の公卿。
sen.e: Sanemichi ICHIJO(September 1, 1788 to June 22, 1805) was a Kugyo (high court noble) in the late Edo period.
Sanemichi ICHIJO (September 1, 1788 to June 22, 1805) was a Kugyo (high court noble) in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: 不要な改行を除去しました。
sen.e: Sanemichi ICHIJO (September 1, 1788 to June 22, 1805) was a Kugyo (high court noble) in the late Edo period.

sen.j: 左大臣一条忠良（後に関白）の嫡男。
sen.e: He was the legitimate son of Tadayoshi ICHIJO, who was the first-ranked minister (of the left) (later on a chief adviser to the Emperor).
He was the legitimate son of Tadayoshi ICHIJO, who was Sadaijin (minister of the left) (later on a chief adviser to the Emperor).
sen.cmt: 「左大臣」の訳語は用語集を参照しました。
sen.e: He was the legitimate son of Tadayoshi ICHIJO, who was Sadaijin (minister of the left) (later on a chief adviser to the Emperor).

sen.j: 弟に一条忠香・久我建通がいる。
sen.e: His younger brothers were Tadaka ICHIJO and Takemichi KOGA.
His younger brothers were Tadaka ICHIJO and Takemichi KOGA.
His younger brothers were Tadaka ICHIJO and Takemichi KOGA.
He titled himself Seigenin.
He titled himself Seigenin.
He titled himself Seigenin.

sen.j: 享和元年（1801年）に元服して、従五位下左近衛権少将に任ぜられ、その年の内に従四位下左近衛権中将に、更に翌年には正四位下へと昇進する。
sen.e: He was promoted to the rank of Major General in left KONOE of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 1801, to the rank of Lieutenant General in left KONOE of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Lieutenant General in the same year, and to the rank of Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in the next year.

He reached the manhood and was promoted to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Sakone gon no shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) in 1801, to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Sakone gon no chujo (Provisional Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) in the same year, and further to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in the next year.
sen.cmt: 「元服して」の訳漏れを修正しました。官位名は用語集の用語を参照して修正しました。
sen.e: He reached the manhood and was promoted to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Sakone gon no shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) in 1801, to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) Sakone gon no chujo (Provisional Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) in the same year, and further to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in the next year.

sen.j: 享和3年2月19日 (旧暦)（1803年4月10日）、従三位に昇進して公卿に列する。
sen.e: On April 10, 1803, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and became a Kugyo (high court noble).
On April 10, 1803, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and became a Kugyo (high court noble).
On April 10, 1803, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and became a Kugyo (high court noble).

sen.j: 文化元年（1804年）には権中納言兼左衛門督に任じられる。
sen.e: In 1804, he was appointed as Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor) and the left Imperial Guide Supervisor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1804, he was appointed as Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor) and the left Imperial Guide Supervisor.
In 1804, he was appointed as Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state) and the left Imperial Guide Supervisor.
sen.cmt: Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor)→Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state)統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: しかし、翌年に18歳の若さで病死した。
sen.e: However in the next year, he died of sickness at the young age of 18.

sen.j: このため、弟の忠香が実通の養子として一条家を継ぐ事になった。
sen.e: Therefore, his younger brother Tadaka, as Sanemichi's adopted son, was inherited with the ICHIJO family.
Therefore, his younger brother Tadaka, as Sanemichi's adopted son, inherited the Ichijo family.
